results.title: Choosing a dog
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Frank Gardner
results.brief_description: A film survey of British bred dogs. The salient physical and mental characteristics of different breeds are examined and appealing portraits of canine favourites appear on the screen. A more serious activity of these animals - their invaluable services as guide dogs to the blind - is also illustrated.

results.title: Choose with care
results.brief_description: This is an information and training program designed to assist organisations establish a safe environment for the children and young people in their care such as child care centres, youth groups, sports clubs, before and after school care programs and all other organisations working with children and young people. It provides a proactive, preventative and participatory approach to building and maintaining child safe organisations. A comprehensive handbook is also included in this package.

results.title: Cholesterol: eat your heart out
results.brief_description: Set in Toronto, this film follows an experiment designed to determine the effect of diet on the blood cholesterol level of high school students. Points out benefits of reducing cholesterol in the diet. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Choking: to save a life. - Revised edition.
results.brief_description: Describes the lifesaving procedures for clearing the airway of a choking person. Examines causes and symptons of choking and emphasizes the necessity for rapid reaction time in treating the choking victim.

results.title: Choking
results.brief_description: Covers first aid for choking in a variety of situations, using practical demonstrations and animation to explain procedures. Also covers aspects of self-help and first aid for pregnant women who are choking.

results.title: Choicest Ceylon
results.brief_description: Deals with the subject of Ceylon tea, from picking to export. Shows the normal process of picking, weighing, carting, withering, rolling, crushing, blending and packaging.

results.title: Choices
results.brief_description: Shrinkage is the unaccountable disappearance of merchandise and can cost companies large amounts of money. “Shrinkage” may be due to external theft, administrative errors and internal theft. This program looks at the last of these three, through the experiences of two newly recruited shop assistants, and how they react to pressure to bend or break the rules. The program proposes four solutions to “shrinkage”. Be conscientious in every procedure, know the rules and follow them, don’t get involved with others’ weaknesses, although you should report suspicious behaviour and lastly avoid temptation yourself.

results.title: Chocolates, giants and peaches. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Roald Dahl, recorded live at the Dallas Brooks Hall in Melbourne, talks about his writing and reads aloud from his own books, including Revolting Rhymes”, “BFG”, “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory”, “Matilda and “Dirty Beasts”.

results.title: Chocolate
results.brief_description: Shows people, including Woody Allen, Jonathon Winters and Jo Ann Worley, tasting a cocoa bean and trying to guess what it was. The film depicts, without narration, the manufacture of chcolate from the extraction of the nuts from the cocoa buds to the addition of sugar to the chocolate powder.
